meanings.definition: The quality of being determined by chance, whim, or impulse rather than by necessity or reason.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's arbitrariness in picking group members surprised us all.
meanings.sent2: The arbitrariness of the weather made planning the picnic difficult.
meanings.sent3: His arbitrariness in choosing toppings for his pizza led to a strange combination.
meanings.sent4: The arbitrariness of fate can sometimes lead to unexpected opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The arbitrariness of the lottery draw kept everyone on edge.

meanings.definition: The state of being subject to individual judgment or preference rather than based on a set rule or standard.
meanings.sent1: We were frustrated by the arbitrariness of the referee's decisions.
meanings.sent2: The arbitrariness of the dress code at the party allowed for creative outfits.
meanings.sent3: The arbitrariness of the traffic lights made the intersection chaotic.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, the arbitrariness of beauty standards is constantly debated.
meanings.sent5: The arbitrariness of fashion trends can be seen in the ever-changing styles.
